noun.description: The action of reversing or inverting something; the result of this.
Aeronautics (originally US). A manoeuvre in which the direction of the aircraft is rapidly reversed, usually consisting of a half loop followed immediately by a half roll. Now rare.

origin: Early 17th century. From French renversement action of reversing or inverting, result of this, manoeuvre in which the direction of an aircraft is rapidly reversed from renverser + -ment.
